_description: KSAU v24.0 5-Survey Weak Lensing Dataset â€” Session 5 (R-1, R-6 compliance)
_note: All 5 surveys are pure weak lensing (z_eff < 1), enabling clean LOO-CV. CMB lensing surveys removed from LOO-CV pool per ng.md Session 4 verdict.
_ssot: All S8, k_eff, z_eff values from published peer-reviewed measurements. No hardcoded theory values.
_independence_note: DES Y3, HSC Y3, KiDS-Legacy have non-overlapping sky footprints. CFHTLenS (~154 sq deg CFHT/MegaCam equatorial) is largely independent. DLS (20 sq deg, 5 northern subfields) is fully independent. Sky overlap between CFHTLenS and KiDS is marginal (<5%).
_ordered_by_k_eff: DES Y3 (0.15) < CFHTLenS (0.20) < DLS (0.22) < HSC Y3 (0.35) < KiDS-Legacy (0.70)

DES Y3.notes: DES Year 3 cosmic shear. Southern hemisphere.

CFHTLenS.ref: Heymans et al. (2013), MNRAS 432:2433; S8 = sigma8*(Omega_m/0.3)^0.55 = 0.748+-0.058, renormalised to S8 pivot 0.5
CFHTLenS.notes: Canada-France-Hawaii Telescope Lensing Survey. Conservative error used due to systematics. Independent footprint from DES/HSC/KiDS.

DLS.notes: Deep Lens Survey. 5 independent subfields, northern hemisphere. Fully independent footprint.

HSC Y3.notes: Hyper Suprime-Cam Year 3 cosmic shear. Northern hemisphere.

expected_leech_assignment._note: IF R_base = 3/(2*kappa) = 11.459 Mpc/h (SSoT), expected R0 = R_base * shell_mag
expected_leech_assignment._prediction: k_eff ordering (ascending) should anti-correlate with shell_mag: smallest k_eff -> largest shell
